abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Justice Services
            Strengthening Project for Colombia were as follows: outcomes
            were moderately satisfactory, risk to development outcome
            was negligible to low, Bank performance was moderately
            satisfactory, and Borrower performance was moderately
            satisfactory. Some lessons learned included: creation of a
            project management unit (PMU) for one particular project, or
            ideally reliance on the government’s own resources for
            project management, are alternatives that should be
            evaluated closely based on the nature of the project and the
            capacity of the government to execute it. The challenges
            that the implementation completion report (ICR) faced in
            validating the achievement of the project development
            objective (PDO) based on the results framework confirms the
            attention that project preparation needs to pay to
            establishing a clear causal chain between project
            objectives, outputs, and results indicators. ICR interviews
            validated the significant potential impact of decentralized
            service centers on making justice services more accessible
            to citizens. The confusion that justice sector stakeholders,
            ranging from judges to lawyers and citizens, seem to have
            experienced during the transition to the oral system
            confirms that any comprehensive reform initiative should be
            accompanied by a strong change management and training
            agenda. The ICR understands that the unified management
            model that the Judiciary is setting out to establish may
            serve this need. Future interventions can consider including
            initiatives where different cities learn from each other’s
            experiences and even assist each other in addressing
            bottlenecks in reform implementation.

repnme.cdata!:
Colombia - Justice Services Strengthening
            Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Justice Services
            Strengthening Project for Colombia is to strengthen the
            capacity of the Judiciary and the Ministry of Interior and
            Justice (MIJ) to deliver timely, efficient, effective and
            quality dispute resolution services to citizens. This
            restructuring paper seeks the approval of an extension to
            the loan's closing date for a period of six months. The
            new loan closing date will be June 30, 2014. Another reason
            supporting the need for closing date extension is the entry
            into force of a new regulation, the Codigo General del
            Proceso (CGP), (New Procedural Code). The CGP is focused on
            implementing the oral system in the resolution of civil cases.

repnme.cdata!:
Colombia - Justice Services Strengthening
            Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Justice Services
            Strengthening Project for Colombia is to strengthen the
            capacity of the Judiciary and the Ministry of Interior and
            Justice (MIJ) to deliver timely, efficient, effective and
            quality dispute resolution services to citizens. The
            reallocation is necessary to shift proceeds of the loan
            across categories of expenditure as presented in detail in
            table no. 1. The reallocation will shift US$400,000 from the
            unallocated category of Expenditures to part C.1 of the
            project in order to adequately finance the justice services
            map implemented under the Ministry of Justice and Law. The
            justice services map allows citizens to access, via the web,
            a directory of geo-referenced judicial institutions in order
            to locate the closest institution to initiate the procedures
            required to enforce users' rights. In order to improve
            the usefulness of the justice services map, by making the
            system's information more user-friendly and ensuring
            that the information contained therein is current and
            addresses the different queries of citizenship, it is
            necessary to carry out a process of updating the
            portal's information system (legal and contact), as
            well as its graphic design to align it with the image of the
            Ministry of Justice and Law and the provisions of the
            'online government'. The goal of this initiative
            is to diminish the delay in the resolution of certain types
            of cases, such as, debt cases where there is no opposition
            of the debtor and the plaintiff is a bank or other financial
            corporation. The reallocated amounts will also be used for
            initiatives related to the creation of the electronic file
            ('e-file') in the labor, civil and family courts.
            Due to their nature, these activities will require a
            considerable investment in technological equipment to allow
            the judicial branch to improve the organization of their
            archives by improving the search process of files, as well
            as to significantly reduce the space required for archiving
            facilities. Finally, a minimal amount of the resources
            reallocated to category one will be used to complete the
            funding of other activities that are currently under execution.

display_title.display_title:
Colombia - Justice Services
            Strengthening Project : restructuring : Main report
